metadata.title: CVE-2017-15412 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in libxml2 before 2.9.5, as used in Google Chrome prior to63.0.3239.84 and other products, allowed a remote attacker to potentiallyexploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1
python-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1
python3-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1').
chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1').
